D.C. police on Monday arrested a second suspect in the May 6 beating death of a 60 - year - old man who authorities said was robbed along a strip of restaurants and taverns on Capitol Hill 's Barracks Row .
Police said Patrick was arrested about 7:15 a.m. by members of the Capital Area Regional Fugitive Task Force .
Police said Patrick was arrested about 7:15 a.m. by members of the Capital Area Regional Fugitive Task Force .

Patrick , along with Zerrick Brown , 42 , of Northwest , are each charged in the slaying of Carlton Coltrane , of Southeast , who police said was attacked about 12:50 a.m. at a 7 - Eleven store in the 400 block of Eighth Street SE , about two blocks from the Eastern Market Metro station .

According to a charging document filed last week in D.C. Superior Court , Coltrane was inside the convenience store buying groceries when a man standing next to him at the cashier grabbed him and dragged him out of the store .

At home , relatives noticed his injuries and called an ambulance .
Police said he was taken to George Washington University Hospital , where he was treated and released .
